words.definition: An organized group of humans that have culture and government.
words.example: Most early civilizations in Central America didnâ€™t use metal weapons.

words.definition: When something is easy to do and does not take a lot of work.
words.example: The bus is a convenient way to get to school.

words.definition: A living space for some types of animals, such as lions.
words.example: The mother lion left her babies in the den.

words.definition: The drops of water that form on the ground in the morning.
words.example: The grass was wet with dew.

words.definition: When something is extreme or very strong.
words.example: The company made a drastic change to its policy.

words.definition: A way to leave a place.
words.example: The emergency exit is at the back of the building.

words.definition: A group of animals, such as birds or sheep.
words.example: A large flock of birds flew over the field.

words.definition: To bend something so that one part covers another.
words.example: I folded the letter and put it in an envelope.

words.definition: A cover for a container.
words.example: He put the lid on the jar.

words.definition: To seem large and scary.
words.example: The dark clouds loomed over the city.

words.definition: When something is very strong or large.
words.example: The mighty oak tree stood in the middle of the field.

words.definition: A type of fungus that is shaped like an umbrella.
words.example: I found some mushrooms growing in the woods.

words.definition: When someone was born in a particular place.
words.example: She is a native of New York City.

words.definition: A substance that can cause sickness or death.
words.example: The berries were filled with poison.

words.definition: A tall, thin plant that grows near water.
words.example: The reeds swayed in the wind.

words.definition: A piece of armor used for protection.
words.example: The soldier used a shield to protect himself.

words.definition: When there is a lot of rain and wind.
words.example: The stormy weather made it difficult to drive.

words.definition: To move slowly from side to side.
words.example: The trees swayed in the breeze.

words.definition: Related to a city.
words.example: Living in an urban area can be very loud.

words.definition: To walk through water.
words.example: We waded across the shallow stream.
